oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from W. L. Leacock to Bishop Leonidas Polk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bishop Leacock, of New Orleans, expresses his shock over Bishop Polk's decision to accept a commission in the Confederate Army. "I am afraid of the Polkism of yr. nature." The Episcopal conference, like most Protestant denominations, had split over slavery and the coming war. Leacock writes that he will not attend an upcoming denominational meeting, because it had lost its object since the dismemberment is "now a fact, recognized by the whole Confederacy."
